deck_excerpt: A P-kid deck with the DPE Structure.
deck_description:
Instant Fusion for Restrict which can counter Ash and blossom, or for rocket for further values

Mystic mine with Rocket and lampsies can burn ur opponent down.

Remember when your opponent have monsters on the field and you have prank-kid place, your place can chain the atk decrease so your opponent can't stop you from special summoning.

Combo chain: Any pkid- link 1- special summon fansies-link doo-entomb pkid fusion and chain doo to search for pkid pranks- link another doo- tribute doo for any pkid and pkid fusion- pkid pranks discard the monster for a token-bark- set the fusion spell and pass. At the start of opponent's turn, tribute bark-two pkids, then fusion for butler, and now you have two instant swipes, a 3000-3000 big guy, 3 pkid monsters and all of them can't be destroyed by effects.

DPE is the plan b, it's just simply strong.

Link spider can change the tokens so you can link anaconda. Anaconda can fetch for Thunder dragon fusion for fusioning the batler, it can also banish it from grave for kaiju or fansies.

THE NORMAL MONSTER IS KEY when you have one in your hand you can always make multiple summons, however when using to xyz summon try to use the other sushi's before the normal monster. any other xyz (Zeus, number 70, etc) should be use as a beat stick.

deck_excerpt: Burn your opponent every chance you get
deck_description:
the basic concept of this deck is to stall/annoy your opponent long enough to where he/she summons enough monsters to the field to summon Lava Golem to their side and lock him into place using Gravity bind, Level Limit Area B, or Nightmare wheel. And to navigate around the effects of Gravity bind and Level Limit Area B the support monsters to aid you in burning their life points away consistently over time while no monster higher than level 4 can attack.
and if in the event your opponent tries to destroy the lockdown cards, make sure to have judgement of Anubis on the field and target Lava Golem with it's secondary effect.

Please feel free to edit this deck and tag this deck for any modifications done to it.
OG player from when the game was released and kept up with it until Synchro monsters were released

deck_excerpt:
A Knightmare deck that utilize each card to it's fullest potential while staying as competitive as possible.
Uses banned cards.
deck_description: This abomination is an attempt to make a true Knightmare deck; and when I say "true" I mean you have to use every card in the archetype and every support card created with them in mind. I'm gonna be honest, this deck can do some disgusting things as should be expected of banned cards, but it is not competitive in the slightest. There is no room for hand-traps or meta counter utility, we're pretty much stuck with the World Legacy support which are brick more times than not. I would like to give a tutorial of the combos, but there are so many different ways to play each hand that its kind of impossible to simplify it. I feel that this deck is incomplete and deserves a 60 card variant that can better abuse some of the more niche strategies that can't fit in this 40 card build, but for now here is a Strategy: Go first, this deck cannot go second unless your opponent does nothing. The basic idea is to to use your normal summon starters like, Venus, Girsu, Iblee to set up a basic board and use Knightmare Goblin to use a second normal summon and increase your board further. This deck has a few extenders like the World Chalice, Mekk-Knight, Parallel Exceed, Pot of Avarice, used to help link climb. And a lot of in theme World Legacy support cards to act as interruptions. Your end board will vary greatly and depends on the hand your have drawn. Sometimes you will end on a Knightmare wall immune to targeting, battle, destruction in hopes of unicorn to draw you 4-5 cards your next turn; sometimes you will end on a basic Orcust loop with two negates and an I:P Masquerena; sometimes you'll end with an Avramax with an Iblee on your opponent. There are many more boards, that I will record later. Test Hands: https://youtu.be/2CFHTKr5cuw Side Deck Because I could not fit in every card smoothly, I left them in the side deck as an optional strategy change. Monstrosity "archetype" is designed to summon World Gears Theurlogical Demiurgy which is a go second board nuke. Avida Rebuilder of Worlds can also be used to reset your extra deck. A few other World Legacy cards that could use Girsu Krawler combo, or Topological Bomber Dragon board nuke. I feel bad that I can't give a more in depth analysis, you really just have to experiment with it to figure it out.

The only downside is once you summon a Floowandereeze monster to the field and most likely activate its effect, you are locked out from special summoning any monsters from the hand, deck, extra deck and graveyard. The upside is this archetype is a good support for Monarchs.

deck_excerpt: Probably the most competitive way to play vampires
deck_description:
Intro: I made this months ago after the Vampire support came out, but never uploaded it cuz I haven't touched this website in literal months. The side deck is ass ngl, and the extra deck is pretty full so drop whatever you think isn't necessary for combo. Same as the last deck, you want either Shiranui Solitare/Vampire Ghost Ogre/Uni-zombie + Vampire Familiar/Retainer. There are other combos, I just can't be bothered to make and write them down. Combos: God Hand: Vampire Ghost Ogre + Vampire Familiar/Retainer
  1. Normal Summon Ghost Ogre
  2. Activate Ghost Ogre's Effect and discard Familiar/Retainer and mill Retainer/Familiar. Search out Vampire Grace
  3. Activate Vampire Familiar in grave and discard Grace to special summon Familiar on field
  4. Activate familiar's effect and search out Shadow Vampire
  5. Send Ghost Ogre to grave and to activate retainer's effect in grave
  6. Activate retainer's effect and search out Vampire Domination
  7. Link Summon into Vampire Sucker
  8. Banish Ghost Ogre from grave to tribute summon Shadow Vampire
  9. Activate shadow vampire's effect to special summon Vampire Scarlet Scourge
  10. Chain Link 1: Activate Vampire Grace in Grave to special summon itself , Chain link 2: Activate Scarlet Scourge's effect on summon to special summon Vampire Sucker
  11. Activate Sucker's effect and draw 1 card
  12. XYZ summon Grace and Scourge into Beatrice (that one fairy monster in the extra deck)
  13. activate Beatrice's effect and send Banshee from deck to grave
  14. Banish Banshee from grave to play zombie world from deck
  15. You should have 4-5 cards in hand so set whatever backrow you have (including domination) and end turn. (I wish I had an idea to do something with shadow vampire)
  16. Turn 2: During the draw phase/Standby phase, activate beatrice's effect and send doomking to from deck to grave.
  17. Standby Phase, activate doomking's effect in grave and special summon itself
  18. activate vampire sucker's effect to draw 1 card
The meh hand (I should really make a better combo for this): Shiranui Solitare/Uni-Zombie + Vampire Familiar/Retainer
  1. Normal summon Shiranui Solitare
  2. activate its effect to tribute itself to special summon Uni-zombie
  3. Activate Uni-zombie's effect to mill vampire retainer/familiar
  4. activate vampire retainer/familiar in grave and send vampire familiar/retainer to grave to special summon
  5. (if special summoned vampire retainer):
  6. activate retainer's effect to search out domain
  7. activate familiar's effect in grave and send domain to grave to special summon
  8. activate familiar's effect to search out shadow vampire
  9. Synchro Summon Uni-zombie and Vampire Retainer to summon stardust charge warrior and use its effect to draw 1 card
  10. Normal summon shadow vampire by tributing vampire familiar and activate shadow vampire's effect
  11. use shadow vampire's effect to special summon vampire grace
  12. XYZ summon Beatrice with vampire grace and stardust charge warrior.
  13. do the zombie world thing where you mill banshee on turn 1 and mill doomking during draw phase of turn 2
  14. (if special summoned vampire familiar):
  15. search out a vampire monster (doesn't matter) with familiar's effect on special summon
  16. send your searched vampire monster to the grave to activate vampire retainer's effect in grave
  17. activate retainer's effect to search out vampire desire
  18. synchro summon with vampire retainer and Uni-Zombie to make Stardust charge warrior and draw 1 card
  19. use vampire desire to change vampire familiar to a level 6 by sending vampire grace to grave
  20. XYZ Beatrice with Vampire Familiar  and stardust charge warrior
  21. do the zombie world thing where you mill banshee on turn 1 and mill doomking during draw phase of turn 2
^this combo needs work Turn 2/Side Deck: All the planned turn 2 comes from the side deck.I put the usual Nibiru and forbidden droplet in the side deck. Forbidden droplet since some of the monsters can steal opponent's monsters if they are destroyed by battle. An extra ash ghost banshee and extra zombie worlds in case your opponent is playing a deck that shreads through backrow like butter. Triple Infinite impermeance to have more hand traps. and Finally, the non generic stuff, 1 Extra Jack-o-bolan to help if your normal summon is messed up, 1 Vampire Red baron (this card is super good on turn 2, not so much turn 1), and 1 Utopia beyond to swap out with beatrice or another extra deck monster (I highly doubt any opponent will let you get beatrice's effect off after setting up a turn 1), this monster is good to beat over untargetable monsters while you don't have doomking to carry you. Conclusion: I put way less thought into this deck in comparison to my vampire kingdom deck. Also im writing this at like 12 am. If you have any suggestions, post them below, and if you like the deck, leave a like and lmk you like it by leaving a comment. thanks for reading and enjoy!

deck_excerpt: Rose Dragon and plant combo deck
deck_description: Combo to synchro summon

As pure of a Nemeses build as you can reasonably do and still do somewhat well. The short of what needs to be done is to get cards either on field or in grave as quick as possible while also fueling your banished pile with cards to facilitate the summoning of all of the Nemeses monsters. The extra deck is full of either useful staples, or cards that help you lock your opponent down. Reprodocus is stellar at helping with this as it can help get you a type on the field that you might need to keep your opponent out of.

deck_excerpt: If you have 5 trap card in your hand? You win this match!
deck_description: Viết chiến lược bộ bài của bạn ở đây ...

How to combo?

S1:

Send 1 lv 2 non-tuner ( Maxx"C" or by effect of "Junk Converter")

S2:

Normal summon Junk Synchro, you can summon "Junk Carrier" if you have and normal summon "Junk Synchron" after

S3:

Synchro summon "Junk Speeder" and summon any "Synchron" tuner " Cyberser", "Satelite", "Junk", "Stardust" Synchron

Add "Riving Miracle" or if you have that card in your hand before you can add "Majestic Mirage" by effect of "Stardust Synchron"

S3:

Synchro summon "Power Tool" (Junk Speeder + Satellite) and choose 3 "Living Fossil" or if you have that card in your hand before you can add " Fleur"  pick 2 "Fleur" and 1 "Fossil" by effect of "Power Tool"

S4:

Activative "Riving Miracle" and choose "In your deck" choose "Wish-Convering Dragon" or if your have in your hand before you must choose "In your hand"

S5:

Synchro summon "Stardust Dragon" (Power Tool + Cyberser) and you can only activative 1 draw effect to this synchron summon. Special summon "Wish-Convering" by this effect and if you do, you can speacial summon 1 level 1 Dragon-type monster in your deck.

S6:

Synchro summon "Shooting Majestic Star Dragon"

You can synchro Summon "Shooting Quasar Dragon" if you have "Dopple Warrior"

Use Simoon to activate Whirlwind, Whirlwind searches Auster, normal Auster to special summon the banish cost from Simoon, Sync Simoon with Auster for Full Armor Master and make whatever else you can with your remaining cards.

As always Black Sonic is fantastic

deck_excerpt: Ancient Gear with Magical Hats, Toons, and Infinitrack
deck_description:
The Infintracks are here to help get to Ballista, and Anchor Drill makes for some good XYZ's

Magical Hats sets Geartowns that will either be destroyed by battle or at the end of the battle phase, upon which you can special an ancient gear each from deck. The favored play is to use a Toon Table Of Contents beforehand to activate Toon Kingdom, then when the hats go off and the geartowns pop you get 2 Toon Ancient Gear Golems from deck that come out under the protection of Kingdom, then once you're around to your turn they can direct for 6000.

Beyond this the deck is there to do fairly standard Ancient Gear things.

Synchro Spam with 5's that special from hand with a discard and mainly aiming for the level 2 tuners to make Arcanite, use his 2 spell counters to pop, and then keep climbing to higher synchros.

Power of the Guardians is there to lend extra power+protection to anyone that needs it, and the mythical bestiary's are there for power of the guardians and the Arcanites.
Drytron (Nov '21)
Cute stuff trynna kill stuff
Floowandereeze (TCG)
Cute stuff trynna kill stuff
Get out big Synchro big number! Lets get it! Go! Yes sir!

deck_description: The deck kind of plays itself, because Flundereeze. The Simorgh stuff is really helpful extra options, especially Bird of Ancestry and Dark Simorgh.

deck_excerpt: If you want to play Vampire Kingdom and not think your throwing the duel
deck_description:
Intro: Vampires are my favorite archetype in Yugioh, and it bothered me to see that once vampires got support, everyone immediately concluded to use them in zombie world even though they have their own custom field spell. While I'll admit, Vampire Kingdom sucks, I refused to believe the new support had nothing to help a Vampire Kingdom strategy. So I looked through every vampire card and tried my best to make a deck that could use Vampire Kingdom to its fullest potential (which isn't much). Through my efforts, I found that this deck plays strongest against other zombie decks due to being able to tribute them with sucker, and stealing monsters even with a zombie restrictions. What is listed below is my personal identification of all the cards I chose to use, and their purpose in the deck. After that, I describe the use of basic combos to help you get started. Unfortunately I don't list any 3 card combos since I consider that to be too unlikely to be worth spending time writing down.   ====================================================================================================================================================================================== Main Deck: (9 Cards) Combo Starters: (3x) Shiranui Solitare (3x) Uni-Zombie (3x) Vampire Ghost Ogre (14 Cards) Combo Extenders/Pieces: (3x) Vampire Familiar (3x) Vampire Retainer (1x) Vampire Grace (1x) Shadow Vampire (1x) Vampire Duke (1x) Vampire Awakening (1x) Vampire Takeover (2x) Vampire's Domain (1x) Foolish Burial (2 Cards) Turn 2+ Cards: (1x) Vampire Scarlet Scourge (1x) Vampire Fraulein (1 Card) Bricks: (1x) Glow-up Bloom (3 Cards) Vampire Bricks: (2x) Vampire Kingdom (1x) Vampire Voivode (11 Cards) Tech Card Options: (3x) Vampire Domination (3x) Crossout Designator (2x) Infinite Impermanence (2x) Ash Blossom (1x) Called by the Grave (15 Cards) Extra Deck: (1x) Immortal Dragon (1x) Herald of Arc Light (1x) Formula Synchron (1x) Divine Arsenal AA-Zeus - Sky Thunder (1x) Gaia Dragon, The Thunder Charger (1x) Dhampir Vampire Sheridan (1x) Crimson Knight Vampire Bram (1x) Yuki-Onna, The Absolute Zero Mayakashi (2x) Vampire Fascinator (1x) Vampire Sucker (1x) Avendread Savior (1x) Crystron Halqifibrax (1x) Relinquished Anima   Side Deck Vampire Tech: (1x) Vampire Vamp (1x) Vampire Sorcerer Tribute Removal: (3x) The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere mode (3x) Gameciel, the Sea Turtle Kaiju Monster Negation: (3x) Dark Ruler No More (3x) Forbidden Droplet Monster Removal: (1x) Corpse Dragon Lord Felgrand   ======================================================================================================================================================================================   Combos: Vampire Familiar + Vampire Retainer:
  1. Normal Summon Vampire Familiar
  2. Link Summon into Relinquished Anima
  3. Activate Vampire Familiar in grave by discarding Vampire Retainer
  4. Activate Vampire Familiar on summon to search out Vampire Duke
  5. Activate Vampire Retainer in Grave by discarding Vampire Duke
  6. Activate Vampire Retainer on summon to search out Vampire Takeover
  7. Link Summon into Vampire Fascinator
  8. Set Vampire Takeover
  Vampire Ghost Ogre + Vampire Familiar/Retainer:
  1. Normal Summon Vampire Ghost Ogre
  2. Activate Ghost Ogre's effect discard Vampire Familiar/Retainer, search Vampire Grace, Send Vampire Retainer/Familiar to Grave
  3. Activate Familiar in grave and send Vampire Grace to the grave to special summon itself
  4. Activate Familiar's effect on summon to search Shadow Vampire
  5. Activate Retainer in grave and send Vampire Ghost Ogre to the grave to special summon itself. Activate Vampire Retainer to search Vampire Takeover/Vampire Domination
  6. Banish Vampire Ghost Ogre and normal summon Shadow Vampire tributing either vampire Retainer or Familiar
  7. Activate Shadow Vampire's effect on summon and special summon Vampire Duke from your deck
  8. Activate Vampire Duke's Effect on summon and force your opponent to mill 1 monster
  9. Activate Vampire Grace's Effect in Grave to special summon itself
  10. Activate Vampire Grace's effect and force your opponent to mill 1 monster
  11. Link Summon into Vampire Sucker using Vampire Grace and Vampire Familiar/Retainer
  12. XYZ summon into Crimson Knight Vampire Bram
  13. Activate Crimson Knight's effect and special summon 1 of your opponent's monsters from their grave onto your field by detaching Vampire Duke
  14. Activate Vampire Sucker's effect to special summon 1 monster from your opponent's grave onto their field. Activate Vampire Sucker's effect to draw 1 card.
  15. Link summon into Vampire Fascinator using Vampire Sucker and your opponent's monster
  16. Activate Vampire Fascinator's effect on summon to special summon one monster in your opponent's grave onto your field
  17. Activate Vampire Fascinator's Effect and tribute itself to take control of the monster on your opponent's field.
  18. XYZ summon into Dhampir Vampire Sheridan using 2 of your opponent's monsters.
  19. Set Vampire Takeover/Vampire Domination
  20. On Turn 2, Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), summon Duke, Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a monster they control, send Vampire Voivode to grave.
  21. Activate Dhampir's effect to take control of the monster you sent to the GY. Then activate Voivode in Grave to tribute 2 monsters to special summon itself
(optional) pay 2000 LP to summon Grace from the GY with Voivode when it's summoned.   Vampire Ghost Ogre + Vampire's Domain
  1. Activate Vampire Domain and activate its effect
  2. Normal Summon Vampire Ghost Ogre using Vampire Domain's effect
  3. Activate Ghost Ogre's effect sending vampire domain to the graveyard, Searchcing out Vampire Duke, and sending Vampire Familiar from deck to grave
  4. Activate Vampire Familiar in Grave by sending Vampire Duke from the hand to the grave
  5. Activate Vampire Familiar's effect on summon to search out Shadow Vampire
  6. Normal Summon Shadow Vampire Tributing Vampire Familiar
  7. Special Summon Vampire Retainer from the deck
  8. Activate Vampire Retainer's effect on summon and search out Vampire Takeover
  9. Link Summon into Vampire Sucker using Vampire Ghost Ogre annd Vampire Familiar
  10. Activate Vampire Retainer in grave sending Shadow Vampire from the field to the grave to special summon itself
  11. Draw 1 Card with Vampire Sucker
  12. On Turn 2, Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), summon Duke, Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a card they control, send Vampire Voivode to grave.
  13. If they ever summon from the grave, activate Voivode's effect to special summon itself tributing Vampire Duke and Retainer.
  Vampire Ghost Ogre + Any Vampire Card
  1. Normal Summon Ghost Ogre
  2. Activate Ghost Ogre's effect, Discard Vampire Card, Search out Shadow Vampire, Send Vampire Familiar to Grave.
  3. Activate Vampire Familiar in grave and send Vampire Ghost Ogre to grave. Activate Familiar's effect on summon to search out Vampire Duke.
  4. Banish Ghost Ogre from Grave to normal summon Shadow Vampire.
  5. Activate Shadow Vampire's effect on summon to special summon Vampire Retainer.
  6. Activate Vampire Retainer and search Vampire Takeover/Vampire Domination
  7. Link Summon into Vampire Sucker
  8. Activate Vampire Retainer in the Grave and discard Vampire Duke.
  9. Draw 1 Card with Vampire Sucker
  10. Set Vampire Takeover
  11. On Turn 2, Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), summon Duke, Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a card they control, send Vampire Voivode to grave.
  12. If they ever summon from the grave, activate Voivode's effect to special summon itself tributing Vampire Duke and Retainer.
  Shiranui Solitare/Uni-Zombie + Vampire Familiar
  1. Normal Summon Shiranui Solitare
  2. Activate Shiranui Solitare's Effect, Tribute itself, and special summon Uni-Zombie from the deck
  3. Activate Uni-zombie's effect and send Vampire Retainer from deck to grave
  4. Activate Vampire Retainer's and send Vampire Familiar from hand to grave to special summon itself.
  5. Activate Vampire Retainer's effect on summon to search Vampire Takeover
  6. Link Summon Into Crystron Halqifibrax with Vampire Retainer and Uni-Zombie, Activate Halqifibrax's effect and special summon Glow-up Bloom from the deck
  7. Link Summon with Crystron and Glow-up Bloom into Vampire Fascinator
  8. Activate glow-up bloom in grave to search Vampire Duke.
  9. Activate Vampire Familiar's and send Vampire Duke from hand to grave to special summon itself
  10. Activate Vampire Familiar's effect on summon to search Shadow Vampire
  11. Link Summon into Yuki-Onna Mayakashi
  12. Set Vampire Takeover
  13. On Turn 2, Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), summon Duke, Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a card they control, send Vampire Ghost Ogre to Grave.
  14. When you want to negate a monster on the field and drop its attack to 0, (Must Chain Link 1) activate Ghost Ogre in Grave to normal summon Shadow Vampire tributing Vamprie Duke.
  15. Chain Link 1: Activate Shadow Vampire to special summon Vampire Voivode from the deck. Chain Link 2: Activate Mayakashi's effect to target a monster on the field to negate its effects and drop its attack to 0.
  Vampire Ghost Ogre + Shiranui Solitare/Uni-Zombie
  1. Normal Summon Shiranui Solitare
  2. Activate Shiranui Solitare's Effect, Tribute itself, and special summon Uni-Zombie from the deck
  3. Activate Uni-zombie's effect and send Vampire Familiar from deck to grave
  4. Activate Vampire Familiar's and send Vampire Ghost Ogre from the hand to the grave to special summon itself
  5. Activate Vampire Familiar's effect on summon to search out Shadow Vampire
  6. Link Summon into Crystron Halqifibrax
  7. Activate Crystron Halqifibrax's effect on summon to special summon Glow-up Bloom from the deck
  8. Banish Ghost Ogre from grave to for an additional normal summon
  9. Normal Summon Shadow Vampire Tributing Glow-up Bloom
  10. Chain Link 1: Activate Shadow Vampire's effect to special summon Vampire Retainer from the deck.
  11. Chain Link 2: Activate Glow-up Bloom's effect in grave to search out Vampire Duke
  12. Link Summon into Vampire Sucker
  13. Activate Vampire retainer's effect in grave and send Vampire Duke from hand to grave to special summon itself
  14. Search out Vampire Takeover
  15. Draw 1 card with Vampire Sucker
  16. Set Vampire Takeover
  17. On Turn 2, At the start of your opponent's main phase, Activate Crystron's effect to special summon formula synchron
  18. Chain Link 1: Draw 1 Card with Formula Synchron, Chain Link 2: Synchro Summon into Herald of Arc Light
(Your first Disruption is a negate Herald, and your second is with Vampire Takeover. It MUST be in this order)
  1. Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), Summon Vampire Duke
  2. Chain Link 1: Activate Duke's effect to Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a card they control, send a vampire card to Grave.
  3. Chain Link 2: Draw 1 card with Vampire Sucker.
    Shiranui Solitare/Uni-Zombie + Vampire Retainer [Route 1]
  1. Normal Summon Shiranui Solitare
  2. Activate Shiranui Solitare's Effect, Tribute itself, and special summon Uni-Zombie from the deck
  3. Activate Uni-zombie's effect and send Vampire Familiar from deck to grave
  4. Activate Vampire Familiar's and send Vampire Retainer from hand to grave to special summon itself
  5. Activate Vampire Familiar's effect on summon to search Vampire Duke
  6. Activate Vampire Retainer's and send Vampire Duke from hand to grave to special summon itself
  7. Activate Vampire Retainer's effect on summon to search Vampire Takeover
  8. Link Summon Into Crystron Halqifibrax with Vampire Familiar and Uni-Zombie, Activate Halqifibrax's effect and special summon Glow-up Bloom from the deck
  9. Link Summon with Crystron and Glow-up Bloom into Vampire Fascinator
  10. Activate Glow-up Bloom in Grave to seach out Shadow Vampire
  11. Link Summon into Yuki-Onna Mayakashi using Vampire Fascinator and Vampire Retainer
  12. Set Vampire Takeover
  13. On Turn 2, Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), summon Duke, Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a card they control, send Vampire Ghost Ogre to Grave.
  14. When you want to negate a monster on the field and drop its attack to 0, (Must Chain Link 1) activate Ghost Ogre in Grave to normal summon Shadow Vampire tributing Vamprie Duke.
  15. Chain Link 1: Activate Shadow Vampire to special summon Vampire Voivode from the deck. Chain Link 2: Activate Mayakashi's effect to target a monster on the field to negate its effects and drop its attack to 0.
  Shiranui Solitare/Uni-Zombie + Vampire Retainer [Route 2]
  1. Normal Summon Shiranui Solitare
  2. Activate Shiranui Solitare's Effect, Tribute itself, and special summon Uni-Zombie from the deck
  3. Activate Uni-zombie's effect and send Vampire Familiar from deck to grave
  4. Activate Vampire Familiar's and send Vampire Retainer from hand to grave to special summon itself
  5. Activate Vampire Familiar's effect on summon to search Vampire Duke
  6. Activate Vampire Retainer's and send Vampire Duke from hand to grave to special summon itself
  7. Activate Vampire Retainer's effect on summon to search Vampire Takeover
  8. Link Summon Into Crystron Halqifibrax with Vampire Familiar and Uni-Zombie, Activate Halqifibrax's effect and special summon Glow-up Bloom from the deck
  9. Set Vampire Takeover
  10. On Turn 2, At the start of your opponent's main phase, Activate Crystron's effect to special summon formula synchron
  11. Chain Link 1: Draw 1 Card with Formula Synchron, Chain Link 2: Synchro Summon into Herald of Arc Light
(Your first Disruption is a negate Herald, and your second is with Vampire Takeover. It MUST be in this order)
  1. On Turn 2, Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), summon Duke, Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a card they control, send Vampire Ghost Ogre to Grave.
  2. If Glow-up Bulb is ever sent to the graveyard, search out either Shadow Vampire or Vampire Fraulein
  Shiranui Solitare/Uni-Zombie + Vampire's Domain
  1. Activate Vampire's Domain and pay 500 LP to activate its effect
  2. Normal Summon Shiranui Solitare
  3. Activate Shiranui Solitare's Effect, Tribute itself, and special summon Uni-Zombie from the deck
  4. Activate Uni-zombie's effect and send Vampire Familiar from deck to grave
  5. Activate Vampire Familiar's and send Vampire's domain from the field to the grave to special summon itself
  6. Activate Vampire Familiar's effect on summon to search out Shadow Vampire
  7. Link Summon into Crystron Halqifibrax
  8. Activate Crystron Halqifibrax's effect on summon to special summon Glow-up Bloom from the deck
  9. Normal Summon Shadow Vampire Tributing Glow-up Bloom
  10. Chain Link 1: Activate Shadow Vampire's effect to special summon Vampire Retainer from the deck.
  11. Chain Link 2: Activate Glow-up Bloom's effect in grave to search out Vampire Duke
  12. Link Summon into Vampire Sucker
  13. Activate Vampire retainer's effect in grave and send Vampire Duke from hand to grave to special summon itself
  14. Search out Vampire Takeover
  15. Draw 1 card with Vampire Sucker
  16. Set Vampire Takeover
  17. On Turn 2, At the start of your opponent's main phase, Activate Crystron's effect to special summon formula synchron
  18. Chain Link 1: Draw 1 Card with Formula Synchron, Chain Link 2: Synchro Summon into Herald of Arc Light
(Your first Disruption is a negate Herald, and your second is with Vampire Takeover. It MUST be in this order)
  1. Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), Summon Vampire Duke
  2. Chain Link 1: Activate Duke's effect to Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a card they control, send a vampire card to Grave.
  3. Chain Link 2: Draw 1 card with Vampire Sucker.
  Shiranui Solitare/Uni-Zombie + Any Vampire Card
  1. Normal Summon Shiranui Solitare
  2. Activate Shiranui Solitare's Effect, Tribute itself, and special summon Uni-Zombie from the deck
  3. Activate Uni-Zombie's effect to send Vampire Retainer from deck to grave
  4. Activate Vampire Retainer in grave and send a Vampire card from your hand to grave
  5. Activate Vampire Retainer's effect on summon to search out Vampire Takeover
  6. Synchro Summon into Immortal Dragon
  7. Activate Immortal Dragon's effect to mill Vampire Duke
  8. On Turn 2, Activate Vampire Takeover (Must be Chain Link 1), summon Duke, Force your opponent to throw away a card you KNOW they have (usually a monster). Destroy a monster they control, send Vampire Voivode to grave.
  9. If your opponent ever special summons from the Grave, activate Voivode in Grave, tributing Duke and Immortal Dragon to special summon itself.
======================================================================================================================================================================================   Notes/Tips: -I forget this all the time when I'm playing, GLOW UP BULB AND VAMPIRE FASCINATOR LOCK YOU INTO ZOMBIES. This means you cannot special summon from your opponent's grave AT ALL. You Can't use Vampire Fascinator to steal a monster or use Vampire Bram or use Dhampir Vampire Sheridan to steal. This Restriction is ONLY bypassed if your opponent is ALSO playing a zombie deck. -Vampire Vamp combos best with Vampire Sorcerer for a turn 2 play. Ghost Ogre is capable of one card comboing into Vampire Vamp if you play these 2 cards together. -Vampire Bram will summon itself back Every Standby phase if its destroyed in any way. Meaning, if your able to attack with another XYZ monster while thats on the field, you can easily make AA-Zeus with it without giving up any powerful XYZ monsters. -Vampire Bram and shadow vampire's attack disabling effect can be ignored if you use their effects on Main Phase 2. -Dhampir Vampire can steal a monster that is sent to the graveyard by any card. This can be by battle, or by a card effect or by its own effect. -Vampire Fraulein + Vampire Domain leaves you with literally no reason to not spend 3000 LP every time a monster attacks. If you get 2 Domains on field, you'll gain an additional 3k LP per attack on monsters. -In the event you draw 1 of your combo pieces, and you don't have a search target, Just search out Fraulein or Domination instead. -In the event you open with Vampire Kingdom on turn 1, activate it, then search out Vampire Awakening instead of Takeover, then either: A.  Avoid sending Vampire Duke to the grave to special summon from the deck with awakening. B.  Use awakening to special summon Scarlet Scourge from the deck and use its effect to summon Duke from the grave (to simulate Vampire Takeover's effect). -Hand traps are really annoying for this deck since a single one can ruin your play, which is why I play so many anti-hand trap cards -On turn 2, I drop all anti-hand trap andd hand trap cards for board negation cards and kaijus since I don't like running the gamble of "Maybe I'll draw a hand trap that'll stop their play". I'd rather have something that can break their board instead. I also drop 2 Vampire Dominations, Crimson Knight Vampire Bram, and Shadow vampire for more board disruption. -I recommend designing the side deck to your own preference. The only cards I would recommend for the side deck are Vampire Vamp and Vampire Sorcerer. ======================================================================================================================================================================================   Conclusion: This deck is the deck I worked the most on out of all my decks (still gets bodied by solemn judgment). I'm proud to have made this and surprised that I was able to make use of most of the vampire archetype (RIP Vampire Lord, if only you were better). Regardless, it's pretty fun to play for me. I also think my decision-making when it comes to tech cards is amateur as heck and I'm sure someone else could pick better cards than the ones I chose. I hope someone who's a better deck builder takes inspiration from my deck to make something better, (so I can take it and play it) and hopefully make people a little more interested in the side of vampires no one cares about. (Even tho vampires just got support, I still wish they got a link monster to search takeover). Thanks for reading, leave a like if you enjoyed using the deck or love vampires, or leave a comment if you have any suggestions.

deck_description: The strategy is Avramax. That's about it. I'd recommend actually placing the spells instead of automatically placing them, so that you can set up plays for Mekk-Knights. Seriously though, I'd recommend Normal Summoning a Crusadia, then going into Magius. Then you can Special Summon another Crusadia, go into Regulex, and so forth.
Progression Deck 2 [MRD]

This deck was build considering the banlist of 2017. This strategy can be somewhat effective even nowadays against a lot of decks, including meta decks, however competitive decks have now a lot of more consistency than the competitive decks back then, not to mention that we didnt had the handtraps/removal/negates we have today. However, back in 2017, this kind of strategy could really win against the meta, even because the banlist had cards like harpies feather duster banned, dark hole at 2, solemn judgement banned, solemn warning at 1, even thunder king rai-0h was at 2 in 2017. The idea is focused into two main strategies: The first one is based on bring zap mustung and thunder king rai-oh with ties of the brethren, and to potentialize the lockdown it uses denko sekka, contract with don thousand and anti-spell fragrance, so basically if you have these 5 cards face up on the field (and your opponent draw a spell card which at that time was very common), your opponent cant search, cant special summon during their turn (until they attack), they cant normal summon/set and they cant set or activate spell/traps (except traps from hand, which at that time the only one who could actually break this lock was evenly matched). And the second strategy is to swarm monsters on the field with pa/ma for xyz summon and gain advantage with the other members of the family. So what do you think about this strategy? Was this viable at 2017? Is this strategy still viable nowadays?

deck_excerpt: Virtual World uses its highly consistent and handtrap resilient engine to quickly climb up the level/rank 3, 6, 9 and 12 toolbox to end on crazy board
deck_description: This variation of Virtual World uses Swordsoul Emergence to increase consistency by allowing you to search any of your in-archetype wyrm monsters or additional tech choices such as Archnemesis Protos. See https://youtu.be/xNc0qrvm0W0 for explanations of how to combo using this list.

deck_excerpt: Swordsoul Pure with Enforcer, Prosperity  and more handtraps
deck_description:
Going first or second.

Control Variant with good enough OTK potential.

This build uses Enforcer as he has a lot of synergy with Ecclesia (adds back in end phase), Supreme Sovereignity (triggers banish eff), is a great extender, can help to draw cards and is very accessible with 3 Fusion Destiny, 3 Pot of Prosperity, Anaconda, Link Spider.

We are not comboing off in this build, we try to avoid Nibiru, avoid Sphere Mode, Lava Golem etc. by committing less summons.

This build uses 8 handtraps: 3 Ash, 3 Imperm, 2 Droll & Lock Birds. Meta Decks want to go first, we need enough hand traps to stop them. Droll & Lock is really good against all meta decks this November 2021 format (Tri Brigade, Lyrilusc, Drytron, Dragonlink, ...).

We use gold sarc as extender (banish blackout to get a token), instant fusion as extender (SS Ansy tuner lvl 4 fusion) or vs. token collector to SS Thousand Eyes to suck him.

We main deck imperial order because we want to go first and even if we get stopped by opponent's hand traps, Imp Order will shut down many decks from OTKing us. We mainly need a Normal Summon to make our strong Synchros.

 

We need to keep in mind that Prosperity will not let us draw with Mo Ye, so we should go for Taia, Enforcer, not do the whole swordsoul combo in the prosperity turn.

We should keep in mind that Longyuan does 1200 burn damage, gold sarc will give us the blackout trap after 2 of our standby phases, ecclesia can add back to hand if enforcer was sent to GY, dasher can SS in draw phase, ...

Dragite should always be used to excavate. Maybe our opponent tries to neg it. We could have Nibiru in deck.

 

 

We play 1 Protos in the side deck, this wyrm is searchable with Grandmaster and the Swordsoul Emergence spell. Protos can be summoned easily and shut down Drytron completely by calling light. Light can also prevent Invoked Dogma decks from summoning ecclesia, maximus, fleurdelis, Mechaba, ...

We play Evenly Matched in the side deck because it is a very flexible out vs. most meta decks.

 

Weaknesses:

Nibiru, Token Collector, Droll & Lock Bird, Dimension Shifter

Sphere Mode, Lava Golem

Many handtraps stopping the build up: Imperm, Veiler, Ash, belle,...
